node.title: I Play Video Games With My 4-Year-Old, and That’s OK
node.description: Video games may not be harmless, but what are you going to do?

node.title: Starbucks workers at a Buffalo store unionize in a contentious vote.
node.description: The coffee chain’s executives sought to persuade workers to reject the union in an election campaign that began in late August. Workers at a second store voted not to unionize.

node.title: Treasure Hunter Tommy Thompson Jailed 6 Years, Fined $2.1M for Not Saying Where Loot Is
node.description: Tommy Thompson has been wracking up $1,000 in fines for every day he has been imprisoned since being held in contempt of court in December of 2015.

node.title: Americans Making More Money but Say Rising Costs Have Changed Their Spending, Poll Finds
node.description: The poll found 85 percent of Americans are paying more in food and gas in recent months yet only a quarter were making more money since the pandemic.

node.title: Tall Order: New Tech, Barista Burnout Driving Push for Starbucks Unionization
node.description: "It's as though you are making drinks under the pressure of trying to defuse a ticking time bomb," one Starbucks employee said.

node.title: Viral Reddit Post Claims 60-Day COVID Intubation Cost Over $3M, Sparks Debate
node.description: The bill came in at over $3 million, though the Redditor explains, it was totally covered by insurance.

node.title: Starbucks' Buffalo Store Votes to Unionize, Results Unknown for 2 Other Locations
node.description: A Buffalo-area Starbucks voted to unionize Thursday, with two more nearby locations still counting votes.

node.title: What is stopping Max Verstappen from crashing into Lewis Hamilton to win the Formula 1 championship?
node.description: Formula 1 has the season finale every fan wanted to see. But aggressive driving and desire for success could lead to a dramatic and controversial conclusion, writes Michael Doyle.

node.title: On a single breath, David Mulheron is pushing to be the world's deepest person
node.description: Imagine a 25-metre swimming pool and swimming eight laps of it on a single breath. Australia's freediving record holder is pushing past that to be the best in the world.

node.title: Anti-domestic violence group wants media to do better
node.description: Activists say there is a noticeable discrepancy in the manner that violence against non-Indigenous and Indigenous women is reported.

node.title: 'It is critical':  More regional Queenslanders need to get COVID-19 jab, CHO says
node.description: About 1.4 million Queenslanders remain unvaccinated against COVID-19, including large numbers of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, regional residents and ineligible children aged under 12, ahead of interstate borders reopening to hotspots next week.

node.title: 'A real talent': How Pat Cummins compares to Aussie Test great Alan Davidson
node.description: Australia's new Test skipper is still early in his career, but comparisons to cricket legends such as Alan Davidson are not wide of the mark.

node.title: Children will soon be eligible for a COVID-19 vaccine. But what if parents disagree?
node.description: Now that children younger than 12 are eligible for a COVID-19 vaccine, some say we could see an increase in Family Court matters. But the courts have already put measures in place to prioritise such disputes, should they arise.

node.title: Australian government 'in denial' over its handling of French submarine row, ambassador says
node.description: France has restored "a degree of trust" with the United States but not with Australia after a debacle over Canberra's cancellation of a multi-billion dollar submarine deal with Paris.

node.title: Kiwi nurse hitches ride on yacht after missing out on MIQ
node.description: A nurse who sailed home because she couldn't get a slot in MIQ and another who's given up trying say there are still too many barriers to getting nurses back to New Zealand.

node.title: 16-Year-Old Willard Miller Wants to Be Tried as Juvenile on Charge He Murdered Teacher
node.description: The attorney for one of two teens charged with murdering their teacher asked for his case to be moved to juvenile court, where his sentence would be shorter.

node.title: These 14 Republicans Defy Trump, Vote to Break Filibuster for Dems to Raise Debt Ceiling
node.description: Democrats will now be able to raise the debt ceiling with a fast-track simple majority vote in the Senate.

node.title: Silver Ferns defender Sulu Fitzpatrick awarded top prize
node.description: The 29-year-old completed a defining 2021 through her influential play and irrepressible leadership skills to win the Dame Lois Muir Supreme Award.

node.title: As inflation jumps, clothing prices rise at record pace online
node.description: Apparel up 17% in past year, making it more expensive consumer item this November compared to last, according to new data.

node.title: ‘A Son (Un Fils)’ Review: The Pain of Others
node.description: In this Tunisian drama, a terrorist attack sends a husband and wife into a spiraling crisis, opening a world of hurt and understanding.

node.title: Lanora Vasquez Sues Portland, Oregon, Says Tear Gas Caused Damage to Her Menstrual Health
node.description: Lanora Vasquez requests a jury trial and an acknowledgment that the city negligently used tear gas during demonstrations in the summer of 2020.

node.title: Tasmania could get an offshore wind farm with capacity to power hundreds of thousands of households
node.description: A multi-billion-dollar wind farm that could take up an area as big as Cape Barren Island has been proposed off Tasmania's north-east.

node.title: The first rule of doing business in China? Don't get political. Women's tennis ripped up the rule book
node.description: One sports organisation is standing up to the rising superpower and refusing to back down, and it's not clear authorities in Beijing know what to do next, writes Carrington Clarke.

node.title: Farmer shareholders vote in favour of Fonterra's planned revamp of capital structure
node.description: Fonterra farmer shareholders have voted overwhelmingly in support of a plan to revamp the co-operative's capital structure.

node.title: Mitchell explains England departure
node.description: The former All Blacks coach John Mitchell denies he abruptly quit his job as England's defence coach after a falling out with Eddie Jones.

node.title: Covid-19: Pfizer says booster shot promising against Omicron
node.description: Pfizer and BioNTech have said a booster jab of their coronavirus vaccine promises to be an effective defence against the new Omicron variant.

node.title: Kenepuru Sound road access restored after July storm - for residents only
node.description: Residents in the Kenepuru Sound finally have road access, more than four months after the July storm caused significant damage to the roading network.

node.title: What to Watch This Weekend
node.description: A wild Formula 1 season comes down to its dramatic final race.

node.title: China committed genocide against Uyghurs, independent tribunal says
node.description: An independent, unofficial body set up by a prominent British barrister to assess evidence on China's alleged rights abuses against the Uyghur people finds the Chinese government committed genocide and crimes against humanity.

node.title: These students got together to talk about suicide prevention. The results could help others across Australia
node.description: There are promising signs a suicide prevention program, being trialled in certain high schools, could help to reduce suicidal thoughts and behaviours of students.
